H0.text: Skin is where nerve cells that sense touch are mainly found.

H1.text: Stomach is the main location where nerve cells that sense touch are found.

H2.text: Brain is the main location where nerve cells that sense touch are found.

H3.text: Lungs are the main site where nerve cells that sense touch are found.

A4.text: It harbors many mechanoreceptors (nerve endings) that provide the sense of touch and heat through nociceptors and thermoreceptors.

A5.text: contains a variety of nerve endings that jump to heat and cold, touch, pressure, vibration, and tissue injury
